channel.title: Runescape on facebook?
channel.description: well as stated on a developer blog. [code]This year will mostly be trying to expand on what we are doing with our social networking sites, with projects from seeing what places to start up new accounts to experimenting with what we can do with the existing ones. More content, more interaction between those sites and the community/game, and more widgets are what I’m working on at the moment. I’ve also enjoyed making the odd couple of posts on the RS forums, so I’ll be trying to show my face there a bit more.[/code] to me this kind of hints to a facebook app. if this was so would you play rs on fb?

item.title: Runescape on facebook?
item.dc:creator: @Statik97 Statik97
item.description:
@Statik97 wrote:

[quote=“licorish55, post:34, topic:326316”][quote author=Statik97 link=topic=422730.msg3112410#msg3112410 date=1264644128]

No, I’d Rather Have Regular Runescape Back Too Where There Was No Trade limits, back in 2001-2007
[/quote]im with ice ticker, I might have never got into coding and never playing PS’s if it wasnt for runescapes trade limits. The trade limit made the game gay, then on top of that, PVP got tooken away and turned into pvp worlds. I wont start playing Runescape no matter where it is on fb or runescape.com till the pvp worlds and trade limit change

Jesus Christ kid.
You’re so far in the closet you’re exploring Narnia.[/quote]

Heh, got to admit… good one

Read full topic

I think Jagex owes me money too than.
[/quote]I’m sure you’d need a good lawyer. Plus, court fees are expensive. You’re more than likely going to lose money pursuing something like that. That kid was damn lucky he didn’t make himself look like a fool as well as a hermit.[/quote]

Not if you use a magistrates court, there are funded by Tax and have no jury.
